content_1: Two outbreaks from Bangladesh were reported this week to OIE. 154 birds died in an outbreak that began on April 11 and ended April 15 at Kosha khali poultry complex in Dhaka. An additional 2,346 birds were culled. The other outbreak took place May 9 and 10 on the Al-Akbar poultry farm in Chittagong. 180 birds died and 1,820 were culled.
content_2: An 18-month-old boy from Kafr-El-Sheikh was diagnosed with H5N1 bird flu on June 17. He came down with symptoms after coming into contact with infected poultry, was hospitalized, and is now in stable condition. This is the 81st confirmed human case of H5N1 in Egypt.
